page.title: 13HOUSES OF INTEREST
page.content: 1 {ANNABLES MANOR}- this house was built by a family called Kynnsbourne. Only the foundations are original and in the garden is a sixteenth century wall. The farm connected to the manor was originally a dairy farm but in 1962 was converted to cereals with some animals. The farm has a donkey wheel used for grinding corn. 2 {BYLANDS}- was built in 1700 and underneath the house are tunnels used by the monks of St Albans Abbey to escape when necessary. The house has both oil and solar heating. It has a rare plant, a snake fritillary in the garden. Generally the housing in the area is Victorian with some which is very recent as in the expanding area of new, private houses in north-west Harpenden.
